metadata.title: CVE-2022-29154 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in rsync before 3.2.5 that allows malicious remoteservers to write arbitrary files inside the directories of connectingpeers. The server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client.However, the rsync client performs insufficient validation of file names. Amalicious rsync server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwritearbitrary files in the rsync client target directory and subdirectories(for example, overwrite the .ssh/authorized_keys file).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rsync - 3.1.3-8ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rsync package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.3-8ubuntu0.5').
